definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: So a benign cycle, makes, the scale benefits.
sentences.chinese: 以致形成良性循環，薄利多銷，向規模要效益。
薄利多銷〔商店廣告用語〕。

sentences.english: Well, after all, only small profits.
Our service philosophy is honesty, truth-seeking innovative, small profits but quick turnover.
sentences.chinese: 我們的服務宗旨是以誠信爲本，創新求實，薄利多銷。

sentences.english: In fact small profits is a truth.
sentences.chinese: 其實和薄利多銷是一個道理。

sentences.english: Well, it's been my experience that decreasing your mark-up will increase your turnover rate.
sentences.chinese: 根據我的經驗，只要把售價利潤降低自然就薄利多銷。

sentences.english: Doing Business for a quick return and a small margin fits the psychology of consumers.
sentences.chinese: 薄利多銷做生意，適合消費者的心理。

sentences.english: Low cost " of pursuit is in a popular style " small profits but quick turnover ".
sentences.chinese: “低成本”追求的是大衆化的“薄利多銷”。

sentences.english: The first was that computing could be a high-volume, low-margin business.
sentences.chinese: 第一個理念是電腦技術可以成爲薄利多銷的生意。

definition: (idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
